Job Title: Supply Chain Manager

Location: Sumter, SC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Location: Sumter, SC

About SKF

SKF has been making the world spin since 1907! 

SKF is an industry-leading manufacturer dedicated to a culture of belonging, where our people flourish in an equitable environment that promotes leadership development and career growth. SKF bearings played an integral role in helping Mars Rover collect rock and regolith samples on the planet’s surface.

As an SKF team member, you will join 40,000 colleagues from more than 130 countries developing bearing technology and services that make rotation more reliable and sustainable. Sustainability is at the heart of everything we do. SKF aims to have net zero greenhouse gas emissions at all our production facilities by 2030.

SKF products keep vehicles rolling, power the machines that put food on your table, and even reach into the cosmos as part of the Mars rover mission. Founded in Sweden in 1907, today SKF is publicly traded on the Nasdaq Stockholm with annual sales in 2020 of approximately $10 billion.

Job Position Summary

This position is responsible for all supply chain activities within the Sumter campus, to include production planning, inventory control, shipping, logistics, procurement, and purchasing. Also maintains close relationship with Customer Solutions in order to fulfill customer orders as well as address customer requirements. Maintains dotted-line reporting structure to Cluster Supply Chain and collaborates closely with SKF functional departments (Business Alignment, Logistics, Demand Chain, Group Purchasing).

Job Duties And Responsibilities (including But Not Limited To)

Develop monthly, quarterly, and yearly shipment and inventory forecasts, in collaboration with Sales Support and Finance.Oversees plans to establish production, inventory and stocking levels based on demand and financial requirements.Follow-up on actual versus scheduled production and alters schedules to meet unforeseen and/or unanticipated interruptions in production and supply chain.Serves as Information Owner for DOH/DWM and XA ERP systems.Responsible for the data integrity of the planning systems and user access.Lead efforts for yearly system upgrade testing and validation.Establishes inventory plans and implements programs to optimize inventory levels, including lean management principles in supply chain management to reduce inventories and improve operational efficiencies.Develops and implements plant level policies and procedures for effective management of materials and planning systems.Also responsible for reporting plant wide KPIs to include (but not limited to) Broken Promises, Availability Failures, past due, inventory accuracy, and freight.Participates in S&OE and S&OP planning meetings with SKF Business Alignment team and Sales Support.Responsible for coding monthly freight file and for implementing cost-saving initiatives related to freight and logistics.Responsible for monitoring vendor performance. Coordinates with purchasing/procurement to guarantee that all supply-side requirements are met. Manages the cycle counting policies and programs to maintain and optimize inventory accuracy.

Job Minimum Education/Experience Required

Bachelor’s in Business, Logistics, or related field plus a minimum of 10+ years of directly related supply chain experience5+ of those years in a managerial level supply chain management support role.APICS Certification required.Must be highly proficient in MS Office suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).Thorough knowledge of sales, operations planning, inventory control, and purchasing systems is required. Exhibit strong communication skills both in interpersonal communications as well as in electronic communication in a cross-functional manufacturing environment.Requires a high degree of foresight, objectivity, imagination, and analytical abilities. Ability to effectively interact at all levels of the Company with strong written and communication skills is essential.Three six (6) or more years in forecasting or production planning and/or inventory management in a managerial level capacity is required.Must be experienced in the use of an ERP or software planning system. Experience using Microsoft BI preferred.Prior experienced in a supply chain support role in a manufacturing or industrial environment.

What You’ll Love About SKF

Rest and Relaxation. Enjoy a generous PTO policy and 13 paid holidays.

Work/Life Integration. SKF supports work/life integration, home, family, community, personal well-being, and health.

Diversity in the Workplace. At SKF, we strive to embed Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion in everything we do. By developing a culture of belonging, our people can flourish; leading to an inclusive, equitable environment that promotes leadership, engagement, and innovation.

Best in Class Benefits. SKF cares about the wellbeing of our employees. Comprehensive healthcare options to fit your needs and opt out payment. Added benefits include company paid life insurance, STD, LTD. Supplemental benefits include critical illness coverage, tuition reimbursement, employee discount programs, and much more!

Invest in your Future. Participate in our 401K program that boasts a 10% employer contribution: 100% match up to 5% of your elected contribution (100% Vested) plus an additional 5% company contribution.

Reports to: Factory Manager

Location: Sumter, SC

Job ID: 19753

SKF provides equal employment [and affirmative action] opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.

By applying to this job you acknowledge how SKF treats candidate data. Click HERE to review the SKF Data Privacy Consent

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
